study_overview:
Brief Summary

            This is a Phase 1/2, multicenter, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), and pharmacodynamics (PD) of single and multiple doses of DNL593 in two parts followed by an optional open-label extension (OLE) period.

            Part A will evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD of single doses of DNL593 in healthy male and healthy female participants of nonchildbearing potential. Part B will evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, and PD of multiple doses of DNL593 in participants with frontotemporal dementia (FTD) over 25 weeks. Part B will be followed by Part C, an optional 18-month OLE period available for all participants who complete Part B.
            Official Title
            A Phase 1/2, Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double Blind Single Dose and Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of DNL593 in Healthy Participants and Participants With Frontotemporal Dementia Followed by an Open-Label Extension
            Conditions
            Frontotemporal Dementia
            Intervention / Treatment

                Drug: DNL593
                Drug: Placebo

            Sponsor: Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: URGENT: New SAE Report - Study DNLI-123 - Site 101 (UCLA) - Patient 101-005
emails.body:
Dear Study Team,

Please see the attached Serious Adverse Event (SAE) form for patient 101-005 enrolled in Part B of the DNLI-123 study.

The patient was hospitalized yesterday evening for pneumonia.

Please confirm receipt of this report and let us know the next steps.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCLA Department of Neurology
(310) 555-1234
maria.garcia@med.ucla.edu

emails.subject: Re: URGENT: New SAE Report - Study DNLI-123 - Site 101 (UCLA) - Patient 101-005
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

Thank you for the prompt notification and for sending the initial SAE report. We have received it.

Alex, can you please take the lead on this from the sponsor side? Please acknowledge the report with the site, request the necessary source documents, and confirm the 24-hour reporting timeline has been met with the Denali safety team (cc'd).

Maria, Alex will be in touch with you shortly regarding the next steps.

Best,

Sarah Lee
Project Manager
Syneos Health

emails.subject: DNLI-123-01: Scheduling Q3 2024 Interim Monitoring Visit (IMV) - Site 101
emails.body:
Hi Maria,

Hope you are having a good week.

I'm writing to schedule the upcoming Q3 Interim Monitoring Visit for the DNLI-123-01 study at your site. I would like to propose the week of August 5th or the week of August 12th for the visit.

Please let me know which of these weeks works best for you and Dr. Reed's availability. Once we have a week selected, we can lock in the specific dates.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Re: DNLI-123-01: Scheduling Q3 2024 Interim Monitoring Visit (IMV) - Site 101
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for reaching out.

Unfortunately, Dr. Reed will be on vacation for the first three weeks of August, so the weeks of the 5th and 12th will not work for us.

Would the week of August 26th be a possibility for you? We have good availability on August 27-28.

Please let me know if that works for your schedule.

Thank you,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
Summit Clinical Research

emails.subject: URGENT Follow-Up: Outstanding Data Queries for Study DNLI-001 at Site 305
emails.body:
Dear Dr. Gomez and Brian,

I hope this email finds you well.

I am writing to follow up on the outstanding data queries for study DNLI-001. As of this morning, there are over 30 queries that have remained open for more than 14 days. Timely resolution is critical as we are approaching the database lock for Part A, and these delays are putting our timeline at risk.

I have attached a detailed line listing of the outstanding queries for your convenience. 

Could you please review the list and provide an estimated timeline for when your team expects to have these resolved? Please let me know if you are encountering any issues or require support from our end to address these items.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this important matter.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics
alex.johnson@denalitherapeutics.com

The email serves as a formal reminder and requests an estimated timeline for resolution to ensure the database lock for Part A is not delayed.

emails.subject: URGENT: Protocol Deviation Report - Dosing Error - Study DNLI-001 - Site 102
emails.body:
Dear Alex,

This email is to urgently inform you of a significant protocol deviation that occurred today at our site (102) for study DNLI-001.

This morning, participant 102-2005, enrolled in Part B (FTD cohort), was inadvertently administered a double dose of the investigational product during their scheduled Visit 5 infusion.

The error was identified by the infusion nurse immediately following the procedure. The participant is currently stable, asymptomatic, and is being held for an extended 8-hour observation period as a precaution. All vital signs are being monitored closely and remain within normal limits.

We have documented the event and completed the attached Protocol Deviation form. We require immediate guidance on the necessary follow-up, safety monitoring, and reporting procedures. Please escalate this to the study's Medical Monitor as soon as possible for their assessment and recommendations.

We await your urgent response.

Best regards,

Dr. Evelyn Reed
Principal Investigator
Maplewood Clinical Research
Site 102

The thread involves Alex Johnson escalating the issue to the study's medical monitor for guidance on patient safety and follow-up procedures.

emails.subject: URGENT Notification: Temperature Excursion for DNL593/Placebo - Site 101
emails.body:
Dear Alex,

This is an urgent notification regarding a temperature excursion for the Investigational Product refrigerator at Site 101, Maplewood Clinical Research Center.

The excursion was noted this morning at 8:00 AM EST. The refrigerator stores all kits for the DNL593 study, including active drug and placebo.

Details:
- Duration of excursion: Approximately 6 hours (from 1:45 AM to 7:45 AM EST).
- Minimum Temperature Recorded: 1.2°C
- Maximum Temperature Recorded: 9.5°C (briefly)
- Standard Range: 2°C to 8°C

I have attached the continuous temperature monitoring log for your review. All affected DNL593 and placebo kits have been identified and remain in the refrigerator, but are not being dispensed.

Please provide immediate guidance on the viability of the affected product and instructions on next steps.

Best regards,

Dr. Sarah Chen
Investigational Drug Pharmacist
Maplewood Clinical Research Center
(555) 123-4567

emails.subject: Re: URGENT Notification: Temperature Excursion for DNL593/Placebo - Site 101
emails.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thank you for the prompt and detailed notification. I have received the temperature log.

Please immediately quarantine all affected DNL593 and placebo kits. Label the stock clearly with "QUARANTINED - DO NOT USE PENDING SPONSOR ASSESSMENT."

I am looping in David Lee, our Clinical Supply Manager at Denali, to conduct a formal stability assessment based on the data you provided.

David, can you please review the attached log from the previous email and advise on the viability of the product? Please let us know if you require any further information from the site.

Sarah, we will provide further instructions as soon as the assessment is complete. Please confirm once the product has been quarantined.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Follow-up: Outstanding Action Items from MVR - Study DNLI-001 - Site 102
emails.body:
Hi Sarah,

I hope you are having a good week.

I'm following up on the Monitoring Visit Report from our visit on October 25th. There are a couple of outstanding action items that we need to close out:

1.  Updated Delegation of Authority Log: Please provide the updated log reflecting the addition of Dr. James Peterson as a new Sub-Investigator.
2.  Training Confirmation: Please provide documentation confirming that Dr. Peterson has completed the required protocol and GCP training.

Please let me know if you have an estimated timeline for when these items can be provided.

Thanks for your continued hard work on this study.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Re: Follow-up: Outstanding Action Items from MVR - Study DNLI-001 - Site 102
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for the reminder. 

We have Dr. Peterson's training documentation ready, which I've attached to this email. 

I am still waiting for Dr. Vance to sign the updated Delegation of Authority Log. She has been in back-to-back patient visits today but I expect to have it signed and sent over to you by EOD tomorrow.

I will let you know if there are any further delays.

Best,

Sarah Miller
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCSF Medical Center

emails.subject: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria
emails.body:
Hi Ben,

Hope you're having a good week.

We have a potential healthy volunteer for Part A of the DNL-123 study who is interested in screening. During the pre-screen review, we noted their liver function tests (LFTs) are slightly above the upper limit of normal (ULN). Specifically, their ALT is 1.2x ULN.

The protocol exclusion criterion #5 states 'Clinically significant abnormal laboratory values,' but it's a bit ambiguous for this specific case. Could you please provide clarification on the acceptable range for LFTs for healthy volunteers in this part of the study? We want to ensure we are interpreting this correctly before proceeding with the formal screening visit.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
Westwood Clinical Research Center

emails.subject: Fwd: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Please see the query below from the team at Westwood CRC regarding the LFT exclusion criteria for Part A.

Could you please provide the official guidance from the sponsor on this and reference the relevant protocol section?

Thanks,

Ben

Ben Carter
Clinical Research Associate
Synergy Clinical

--- Original Message ---
From: Maria Garcia <mgarcia@westwoodcrc.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2023 10:15 AM
To: Ben Carter <ben.carter@synergyclinical.com>
Cc: Dr. Emily Reed <ereed@westwoodcrc.com>
Subject: Protocol DNL-123 - Query re: Part A Screening Exclusion Criteria

Hi Ben,

Hope you're having a good week.

We have a potential healthy volunteer for Part A of the DNL-123 study who is interested in screening. During the pre-screen review, we noted their liver function tests (LFTs) are slightly above the upper limit of normal (ULN). Specifically, their ALT is 1.2x ULN.

The protocol exclusion criterion #5 states 'Clinically significant abnormal laboratory values,' but it's a bit ambiguous for this specific case. Could you please provide clarification on the acceptable range for LFTs for healthy volunteers in this part of the study? We want to ensure we are interpreting this correctly before proceeding with the formal screening visit.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Maria Garcia
Clinical Research Coordinator
Westwood Clinical Research Center

emails.subject: Proactive Check-in: Recruitment for FTD Cohort (Part B) - Study DNLI-001 - Site 123
emails.body:
Dear Sarah,

I hope this email finds you well.

I'm reaching out today for a proactive check-in regarding recruitment for the FTD cohort (Part B) of the DNLI-001 study at University Health Center. In reviewing the recent screening logs, I noted that your site has not yet screened any patients for this specific cohort.

We understand that recruiting for specific patient populations can present unique challenges. Our team at Denali is here to support you in any way we can. We'd be happy to schedule a brief call to discuss your site's current pre-screening and recruitment strategies. We can also explore if any additional resources might be helpful.

To that end, I've attached our latest approved patient recruitment flyer and an updated FAQ document for sites, which you may find useful.

Please let me know if you and Dr. Roberts would be available for a 15-20 minute call sometime next week to brainstorm potential solutions.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics
alex.johnson@denalitx.com

emails.subject: Re: Proactive Check-in: Recruitment for FTD Cohort (Part B) - Study DNLI-001 - Site 123
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thank you for reaching out and for the attached materials. We appreciate the proactive support.

You are correct, we have been facing some challenges identifying potential candidates for the FTD cohort. A call to discuss our strategy would be very helpful.

Dr. Roberts and I are generally available next Tuesday or Thursday afternoon. Please let us know what time works best for you to send a meeting invitation.

Thank you,

Sarah Chen
Clinical Research Coordinator
University Health Center
s.chen@universityhealth.org

emails.subject: URGENT: Missing Document in eTMF for Study DNLI-CNS-002 - IRB Approval
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Hope you are well.

During a routine QC of the Trial Master File for study DNLI-CNS-002, I was unable to locate the IRB approval letter for the recently submitted Protocol Amendment 4 (dated 2023-10-15) for our central site, Summit Neurosciences (Site 101).

Could you please investigate this? If you have the document, please upload it to the correct placeholder in the eTMF as soon as possible. If the site has not yet provided it, could you follow up with them?

This is currently holding up our periodic TMF review milestone.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

Sarah Chen
TMF Specialist
Denali Therapeutics
sarah.chen@denalitx.com

emails.subject: [DNLI-001] Site 101 - Participant 101-005 - OLE Rollover Query
emails.body:
Hi David,

Hope you are well.

We have a query regarding participant 101-005. The participant is approaching their Week 25 visit and has expressed strong interest in continuing into the Open-Label Extension (Part C) of the study.

To ensure we can properly consent them, could you please provide clarification on the visit schedule and any specific procedures required for the OLE portion of the trial? We want to make sure we have all the correct information to discuss with the participant.

Please let us know.

Best regards,

Sarah Chen
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCSF Medical Center

Hi Alex,

Please see the query below from Site 101 regarding the OLE rollover for participant 101-005.

Could you please provide the site with the requested clarification on the visit schedule and procedures for Part C?

Thanks,
David
